snippet.title: Buyer wins keys to Glen Waverley home with $35,000 knockout - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:
, was hotly contested by four bidders on July 26.
A GLEN Waverley house that last traded 24 years ago has busted its reserve by $100,000. And more than a third of the price premium came from a final knockout bid. Harcourts Judd White Glen Waverley director Dexter Prack said there was hot competition for , at the July 26 auction. And it helped the four-bedroom home to a $1.2 million sale. "We took 45 bids from four bidders," Mr Prack said. "They were all investors, who were looking at it from a land banking perspective. Mr Prack said bidding opened at $900,000, before the property quickly climbed to $1.165 million. "I was about to knock it down at $1.165 million before someone cast a knockout $35,000 bid," he said. "It was a very hot auction; they all really wanted the property." Mr Prack said the reserve was $1.1 million. Sales records show the home last sold for $195,000 in 1993. SUBURB PROFILE:
, was on a 727sq m allotment.
He added a house at , attracted eight bidders on the same day. He said the fully-renovated home sold beyond reserve for $1.001 million. "It was in a popular pocket of Mulgrave," Mr Prack said. "Mulgrave is experiencing very strong demand at the moment, and anything under $1 million is highly sought." The three-bedroom property was quoting $800,000-$880,000 prior to auction.
